reviews.text: The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful! Apartment very clean and comfortable. Good security. Just a couple blocks to Grafton Street. Airport bus stops about one block away. Easy walking distance to Trinity, Temple Bar, St. Stephen's Green. The alley from which you access the building is a bit dirty and drab, but the building and apartments are very nice. Flower pots on the balcony were a nice homey touch.
reviews.title: Great staff, convenient location

reviews.text: Perfect location for our large group- walking distance to all that we wanted to do in Dublin. Both appartments were lovely to look at and all amenities were nice and as promised. Only one towel holder, though- but that's a small thing.
reviews.title: very nice

likes.disliked: — desk service was on and off and minimal

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.text: Tony, Dierdre, and Rena were all helpful and sweet. Thank you, Molesworth, for helping make our trip so great!
The staff at this place are fantastic.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

likes.liked: — Very nicely remodeled and great location.

reviews.text: We drove from the airport and the printed instructions we got where spot on. Made it very stress free trying to get there.
reviews.title: Top marks!

likes.disliked: — Stairs to all apartments - can imagine this would be annoying if located on top floor!

reviews.title: Needs refurbished
reviews.text: The rooms really need refurbished especially the bathrooms which are very out of date (tile grout etc needs a good scrub).
The apartment we stayed in appeared to have had a leak as the wooden floor was very damaged in the hall.
reviews.title: Cozy and in a great location!

likes.disliked: — No elevator but the staff helped with the luggage. This was not a problem for us but it could be for an older person or someone who has trouble navigating the stairs.

reviews.text: Beds very uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Great Apartment Stay in Dublin

reviews.text: Probably the worst thing about the stay was the fact that the rooms overlooked an extractor fan (from local restaurant ) which when in use was like being above a jet engine getting ready for take off! (went on until 1.30am one night).cooking smells quite noticeable at times.
reviews.title: Location, Location , Location

likes.liked: — We lliked that the location is close to everything in Dublin.

reviews.text: Dont bring a car unless you have to you .Access to car park difficult as trucks etc often park opposite to unload.
reviews.title: Just what we needed

likes.liked: — The size of the apartment, the location, the amenities, everything

reviews.text: Excellent location, just next to Grafton St. National Museum at end of street. St. Stephen's Green less than a block away. Clean, pretty, affordable. Deidre was wonderful.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.text: Molesworth was great! The location was perfect. We walked all over Dublin and felt very safe! We had a 2 bedroom penthouse that had a city balcony! It was cool. My husband and I stayed 3 nights with my parents and it was a great break to be out of hotels/b&bs. We tried using the washer/dryer in the apartment but it ruined our clothes. All of our whites turned a sickly color grey and it took FOREVER to dry something. Not good! At Molesworth you pay for electric usage so don't waste your money with the appliances. The head clerk went on vacation when we got there so after her departure everything was hit and miss. The night lady Diedre was nice. I'd recommend the place but again, DON'T USE THE WASHER/DRYER UNIT!!!!!!
reviews.title: Great Location! Don't use the washer/dryer in the apartment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location! A few minutes walk from Grafton Street, Trinity University and St Stephens Green. Staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. The Molesworth is a group of suites. Ours had a full kitchen, dish washer and washing machine. The living area was clean and cozy which was nice to come home to after visiting the Dublin pubs. The only improvement I would make is to the bathroom. Ours had a hanging curtain and the tiles were moldy from a lack of water drainage. And of course, this caused the bathroom to smell a little musty, but it was clean. If I were to go back to Dublin, I would stay here again despite the bathroom.
reviews.title: Quaint

reviews.text: Stayed at these Apartments in early July. upgraded to the Penthouse for free. These have to be the best apartments I have ever stayed in. Very clean and tidy and in a fantastic location. The Manager was very nice, she supplied tea and coffe and breakfast . I fouund out about it on this site, I'm really glad I found it. It really like staying in a superstars Penthouse.
reviews.title: P Diddy Penthouse

reviews.text: I learned of this property from this site and wanted to say how accurate the reviews are. I spent three nights with my sister and our four children at the Molesworth Court Suites. I was there attending a conference and the property was ideal. As many of the reviewers have noted, it was centrally located so that my sister and the children could take walking and bus tours during the day. The busline was nearby so that I could get to my conference site with little effort. The taxi drivers seemed to not have problems finding the property once they understood the proper address.
reviews.title: Wonderful Accomodations & Great Irish Hospitality
Good location, a few problems though....
reviews.text: We just had 3 nights in suite 12. First impressions were good, the location is great and the apartment is huge with a large balcony and modern kitchen. We did have a few problems though, the first being the heater in 1 bedroom did not work. This caused a fuse to short which stopped the outlets from working. We got the power going, and turned the upstairs heaters on, which worked for about 10 minutes then turned off. This was apparently due to one of the thermostats being to low. The first morning we had only warm water, the second morning we had boiling water coming out of the cold taps and the toilet! The tv had no reception until we played around with the connections and got it working. Deidre the manager was very helpful and apologetic so no complaints there. Overall it represents good value, but i do think that a property that markets itself as "4 star luxury" should ensure that the basics such as heating and hot water are in order. Its also a bit rough in some parts, the down lights look like they were installed by a plumber and holes in one wall filled but not repainted which looked very cheap.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Molesworth Court apartments. We stayed for 3 nights. My husband and I were traveling with my best friend and her husband. We all loved the apartment.
reviews.title: Great location, great value, awesome apartment!

likes.disliked: — lack of hot water in shower.

reviews.text: Location, location, location! This apt is right in the center of Dublin. You can walk virtually everywhere. It is located right off of the main shopping area of Grafton St. (many upscale shops like Louis Vuitton and Chanel and department stores literally only a few minutes walk away). A five minute walk to Trinity College and Dublin Castle and St. Stephen's Green.
reviews.title: Room to Spread Out in Dublin

likes.liked: — It was very spacious; loved having a kitchen and room to spread out
likes.disliked: — It was difficult for our cabdriver to find it

reviews.text: The apt itself was nice. Clean and moderately furnished. We stayed in a two bedroom on the second floor. There was only one bathroom for the four of us, but it was fine. Only vice was that the hot water ran out extremely quickly!! And the beds were not very comfortable. One room had two twin beds. Really only one person could take a 5 minute shower and then there was no more hot water for hours! Other than that the apartment was great. Had a partial kitchen with microwave and stove and refridgerator. It was nice to be able to bring back some groceries for breakfast and snacks.
reviews.title: Molesworth Court, good value, great location

reviews.text: Overall a great value if you are traveling with four or more people in a great location!
reviews.title: Fab location
Upscale bargain if a little rough at the edges
reviews.text: I found Molesworth Suites through TripAdvisor and was not at all disappointed. Hotels in downtown Dublin are expensive so after positive experiences with short-term vacation apartments in Seville and Barcelona, I jumped at the deal Molesworth offered. It was the most expensive accommodation that my two friends and I stayed at during a two-week vacation across Ireland but was still a good deal - about half what you'd pay for a Dublin hotel, on a per person basis.

We reserved 6 months in advance, Per Riona, all that was available was the penthouse. Well, okay... For 295 euros a night (which we divided 3 ways) we got a spacious 2 bedroom, 2-floor flat on the top floor (5th) with a terrace - a real one with a deck. We felt quite posh sipping Irish whiskey, enjoying Dublin sunset , pink clouds and rooftop views. There's a kitchen with all the "mod cons." It was a real home to come home to, 5-10 min. walk from the heart of the action. We stayed three nights.
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Keep in mind there is no elevator. Also, some light bulbs and fixtures need to be replaced/mended and the furnishings were upscale Ikea but not spartan. The most annoying feature was the heavy, self-closing Dublin Fire Dep't-mandated doors on every bedroom and the bathroom. Every time my friends' door banged shut, the handset of the wall-mounted intercom would jump off its cradle (it was clear that thing's been taking a beating for months). More doorstops are in order!
reviews.title: Very Good, But ...

reviews.text: This accommodation was booked last minute. Stranded in Dublin and my accommodation cancelled. Molesworth came highly recommended.
reviews.title: What a lovely find

reviews.text: It is a small building down a service road, but dont let that put you off. Think there are 12 apartments in the building, mixture of 1 and 2 bed. Lovely decor. CCTV protected, underground parking. Ideal location for shopping on Grafton Street and close to Luas line at Stephens Green.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

likes.liked: — The location and quietness of the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The appliances were top-notch. The kitchen included all necessary dishes, pots, pans, silverware, etc. Yes, the washer/dryer took some getting used to, but we were happy to have it. Just remember (Americans) -- don't over stuff!! It was funny how long clothing took to air dry...the climate is very damp. (Although quite mild for January, compared to Pennsylvania!)
reviews.title: Loved it would go back in a heartbeat!

likes.liked: — Apartment style living in the city
likes.disliked: — Bathroom was slightly musty-I think the doors need to stay open more

reviews.text: We just loved the comfortable beds and hard wood floors. Someone in a prior post described it as "Ikea" and I tend to agree. Very nicely appointed rooms. We were on the second floor facing the lovely little courtyard.
reviews.title: Not 5-star
